# addTarget(handler:)

**Instance Method**

Adds a block to be called when an event is received.

## Declaration

```swift
func addTarget(handler: @escaping (MPRemoteCommandEvent) -> MPRemoteCommandHandlerStatus) -> Any
```

## Parameters

- **handler**: A block object to handle the [doc://com.apple.mediaplayer/documentation/MediaPlayer/MPRemoteCommandEvent].

## Return Value

An opaque object associated with the designated handler.

## Discussion

Call the [doc://com.apple.mediaplayer/documentation/MediaPlayer/MPRemoteCommand/addTarget(handler:)] method to add a block to be called. Remove the handler by calling the [doc://com.apple.mediaplayer/documentation/MediaPlayer/MPRemoteCommand/removeTarget(_:)] method, passing in the object returned by this method.

## Handling events

- **addTarget(_:action:)**: Adds a target object to be called when an event is received.
- **removeTarget(_:)**: Removes a target from the remote command object.
- **removeTarget(_:action:)**: Removes a target and action from a remote command object.
- **MPRemoteCommandHandlerStatus**: Constants indicating the status of a command.
